reviews.review_msg: Loved her! Grateful to have taken her in her last teaching semester (Fall 2023).Very helpful feedback, and engaging and hilarious lessons.

Linda is a great prof who was very understanding especially during online learning. For 215, we had smaller recording & listening assignments to do outside of class (+a few readings) but for the 3 main assignments she gives you plenty of time in class to complete them. She is on the tougher side for grading but still quite fair in my opinion.
love her but so hard

Such a gem especially in the French Dept at SFU. Clear, understanding, knowledgeable, approachable, NOT overbearing and teaches really well. I have learned TONS from her and she makes it fun! Amazing assignments -- you get to do a slam poem and have a radio talk show broadcasted among other things. Your French will improve.

Overall, I thought Linda was a good prof. She is always available for help and gives detailed answers to the questions you ask. One thing I really liked about her was that she gave people time in class to work on their assignments and ask her questions in case they couldn't come to her office hours. However, I found her to be a bit of a hard marker

Extremely unreasonable prof. She assigns enough work for three courses, and gives unreasonable and unrealistic amounts of time to get everything done. The work itself is not overly difficult, but she just assigns erroneous amounts of it. It's as if she thinks this is only class you're taking. If you have a job and/or other homework, good luck.

One of the best French profs I had at the SFU French department. I learned and improved after being in her class. Her lessons are amazing, and are very straight-forward and easy to understand. She's very open to her students. I love her!

By far one of the best teachers I've had, gives good feedback and is exceptionally understanding. Barley any homework, no tests, however the assignments in class are very helpful and interesting. Most of the class is weighted with group projects, choose wisely to bring your grade up!

Best French prof I've had, in that I have learnt the most with her. She is a straight up kind of lady, takes no BS, but she is kind and you will improve. Be ready to participate and complete your homework. I had her for 222 and 215 this semester and I'm not sick of her. Smart, knows what's she's doing. The classes take a bit of work, but manageable
Linda is the best. Organized, helpful and approachable.
NEVER take online language course because it becomes extremely hard. Something test in the quiz I didn't learn from the lecture. :(
Prof Linda is so passionate and so helpful. Her video tutorials are extremely clear and easy to understand. Would love to take another course with her.
A good french professor. I would like to take her classes again.
AMAZING... haven't even finished the class yet, but I wanted to post about how passionate and interesting and fabulous Linda is... take her class, she is the best french prof I have ever had!

Linda is a great professor! She is helpful, clear, and fun! French grammar isn't everybody's thing but she at least tries (and I would say succeeds at) making it approachable!  She is a fair marker and responds well to students' questions.  Great professor!

Linda is amazing. She is the hardest marker ever, but amazing. If you work hard, you will do well. She hates laziness, so don't take the course if you are not willing to give 110%! She knows grammar like the back of her hand and is always cheerful and willing to help! A+ Linda!

Translation course. 1) she is very arbitrary and not open to different correct & possible answers; 2) she has no respect for other teachers and students - letting students out 10 mins late every class is unacceptable; 3) it seems to be against her morals to give anything higher than A-; 4) she is most definitely bias towards suck-ups; 5) oblivious.

She is an outstanding teacher. She is very clear and you are going to learn french properly if you take it with her. She is quite strict on the pronunciation but that's a good thing. The quizzes and final exam were on the easy side.
awsome professor! love her teaching style! very friendly and interesting! i always come across her on campus, and she says bonjour to me before i recognize her all the time*^^*
spoke clearly, well prepared, a good prof! This class was really fun, just a hard marker =(

This course was absolutely amazing. It is an oral course but it still has some grammar. Linda is great and creates an awesome atmosphere in the classroom; you will make new friends. I found the course easy receiving a B+ with minimal effort.
I took FRENCH with Linda last year. The class was interesting and Linda is kind and generous prof. But if you do not have no FRENCH background do not take this course and mark booster!

i know everyone thinks she is a really nice prof.! but seriously tho...french 120 is not a very easy course...i took french with her last year...and class average was like c-...only one person got a b-...yah only one! umm...i wouldnt take her class if i were u!!!
GPA booster course. Highly recommended ^^b
mean and made fun of students accent. if i had no accent in french, i wouldnt be a student. i would be the one teaching the course! typical
glad to have linda as my french teacher again!! she's nice, approachable, helpful. one of the best profs in the dept!!
I love her, she explaines everthing very well, the work is little bit hard but is not that hard, just a little bit....
She connects with her students and makes the class fun. There is a  lot of discussions and free time, the class is actually pretty easy, though she is a tough marker.

she's an awesome prof, love her! i dont find that she plays favourites at all. just beware for fren 215 that every little detail counts, you must be grammatically correct orally and on paper!  for fren 221, the class is very straightforward, just make sure you don't take the vocab. portions lightly, you will be tested on it! GREAT PROF!!!!!
Good teacher. Understanding. Not that easy unless you do your work.
i took these courses with her a long time ago. she's a good french instructor. her classes were helpful.

"Wonderful professor"?!?!  She completely lacks any connection with her students and uses a ridiculously unfair marking scheme - not to mention she makes grammar mistakes: "dans vos propres mots" is not French (according to another French prof in the dept)!  And I agree that she plays favourites.
Seems kind of anal and doesn't really make an effort to keep the class interesting.  Also plays favourites.
Wonderful professor.  Wish she would teach upper division classes, though.  I found her to be super supportive and kind.
Linda is an amazing teacher! She can understand any question you ask even when you have problems explaining it.  My only concern is that she only teachers lower divison classes.
Linda is approachable, understanding, great and fun to have. Her class was enjoyable and made my semester that much easier. She makes the class interactive and books are cheap!
She is the best prof that I have ever had, she is very clear and helpful. I loved her class.

I loved this class!! Linda is an awesome instructor who made class enjoyable and fun. She was really encouraging and always available for help. She's been the best instructor I've had in my 4 years at SFU.
great teacher, very understaning, very helpful!
Great prof!  Very friendly and very helpful!  She makes things very clear.  And she smiles a lot. =)
Could provide better notes but if you pay attention, everything's a-okay.
Awesome teacher, makes French easy to learn for everyone
She is awesome. Helpful and makes class fun.
